body: we need this for TS to o.o" -> drop pods
You should also set the paradrop-traits at `^Tank` in ra up or remove them from `^Tank` as we don't have the `ArmorDrop` support power anymore.
We should also fix infantry going prone in air and the death animation somewhen.

Fixed as commented and rebased. Only remains to see about
- the `Parachutable` trait being a prerequisite ~~/ adding the `Freefall` activity and~~ (throw an exception if the `Parachute` activity is run for an actor without the `Parachutable` trait)
- the paratrooper animation (not going prone + death).

Maybe I can get some more input on what would be the right way to go with this PR and what should be left for an additional PR?

I did a quick glampse on the code and while I do appreciate this there's one thing I noticed:

RA2 parachute has a closing sequence as well. It doesn't disappear like the RA1 one, but fall to the ground then play a decayanim. Notsure how to implement this via the upgrade tho.

@GraionDilach, it isn't too problematic to implement the closing sequence. The only question is - seeing how the closing sequence needs to play while the unit is already able to move around, should the animation move with him or play out on the drop location?

In RA2 it moved along with it, it was attached to the unit like the EMP or the mindcontrol animation.

(Actually, WW even had a reason to do that although they made the anim entirely to work exactly with their flying height. The unit had a doesitstillexist check upon the parachute anim and the result was used to decide between applying [General]ParachuteMaxFallRate or NoParachuteMaxFallRate, but since FallRate is directly customizable here, your solution is better than theirs.)

I think moving to the north would look bad if the parachute moves with the infantry (and keeps its relative position), so probably drop the parachute when you hit the ground (a.k.a. play it where they landed). But that would be trickier at best, on top of having people go "that's not what the original did!", so...
So which one should it be? With the current code it would follow the unit.
I'd say current will do in this case.
And I'm afraid these changes call for an upgrade rule.

I'll put the upgrade rule and rest of YAML changes at the very end as @Mailaender once suggested. Otherwise I'll probably need to rebase alot.

Now also prevents paratroopers from idling while in air (#2988).
Aside from those codestyle niggles, this is looking otherwise fine to me. I'll give my :+1: when the upgrade rules are added.

- Replaced `TargetableParachutableUnit` with an upgradable `TargetableUnit`
- Added an upgrade rule
- Upgraded all mods
- Rebased and squashed
Looks ok to me, and works as expected in-game. :+1:
Needs a rebase.
Changed as commented. Rebased.

I don't like the TargetableUnit upgrade implementation. It's okay for this particular case, but it limits us in the long run. There will be cases when multiple TargetType upgrades each having separate effects will be desired. (RA2 paratroopers upgrade the TargetType to air-only while Chrono Legionnaires should upgrade it to Temporal-only, reimplementing the tiberiumheal and tiberiumproof veteraneffects in TS due to both effects rely on TargetTypes in OpenRA to apply their effects as well).

It should be refactored to allow using IdentifierSuffixes in a separate PR.

Fixed as @Mailaender commented. Rebased.

@GraionDilach, I'm not sure I followed what you meant with you remark on `TargetableUnit`, but if it can be done in a separate PR, as you said, I'd say go for it.
This spits out a lot of MiniYaml errors and warnings: https://travis-ci.org/OpenRA/OpenRA/builds/68995836#L1177
Does d2k use parachuting units?
Yes, but without parachute sequence in the Carryall drop.
Is that how things ought to be or do they need a parachute sequence?
They need to have none. My previous traits did not hard-code the sequences and had null checks to omit the animations in that case.
The carryall drop will be removed if we ever proceed to the next stage of the d2k mod.

OK, so basically the lint checks, that have been added since this PR was open, have forced me to do some new stuff. Seeing how `WithParachute` doesn't support rendering the shadow as just the actor's usual sprite with the shadow palette, any parachutable actors that have relied on their shadow being rendered this way will no longer have a shadow when automatically upgrading the mods. I've added the nicer shadow `parach-shadow` manually for crates and d2k paratroops (this doesn't happen automatically as it potentially requires copying the image file and adding a sequence entry).

And, parachuting without a parachute sequence is now also handled with null-checks as before.
Needs a rebase.
Rebased.
What's the situation with this?  It seems a bit unfair that newer prs that conflict with this are being preferentially merged.
@GraionDilach and @Mailaender didn't like how the `TargetableUnit` was modified so I'm waiting for #8662 to get merged before I rebase and use it.
